articles.title: About this project
articles.contents:
“This is data science”
~preceptor
About Me
Hi, I’m Daniel Wang. I am currently about to graduate from White Oaks Secondary School, Ontario. I enjoy doing random coding, currently in unity. I also like to go out hiking, and enjoy nature.
About The Project
This project, The Impact of Covid-19 on Various Student’s Educational Stress, examines the stress levels of students before and after Covid-19, categorizing the stress levels from different sources, and how far they were impacted.
Goals
Show that there was an increase in stress levels during the pandemic
Examine the extend of an impact Covid had on students
This depends on if there is a significant correlation established

Kane’s Free High School Data Science Bootcamp

articles.title: Effects of Covid-19 on Students
articles.description: Examination on the stress levels experienced by students before and after Covid-19
articles.contents:
Students were asked to rate their stress level on a scale of 0 to 6, with 0 being perfectly calm, no worries, and 6 being
Graph 1



There was a general increase in stress levels for students during Covid-19. Prior to the lockdown, the average stress rating was located in the lower half of the distribution. The change resulted in a distribution that was skewed towards the higher levels. The homework stress had a higher average compared to the classwork stress both before and during Covid-19.
This graph splits the responses up by the respondent’s current learning environment to show if different environments experienced stress differently
Graph 2
This graph splits the responses up by the respondent’s current learning environment to show if different environments experienced stress differently



Compared to the first graph, the environment with the highest amount of people in it has similar distributions. Despite fewer data points for the hybrid and physical spaces, there are a few differences between them. Students in physical learning environments had the highest average stress level with class work. Students in virtual learning spaces experienced less stress when compared to the homework stress.
Graph 3



There was a difference between the distribution of stress levels, Females experienced on average a lower stress around classwork compared to males. Males experienced higher stress levels compared to females

articles.title: Data Source
articles.contents: Dataset: COVID-19’s Impact on Educational Stress
